title: Login Error - Connection Failure: Unable to connect to PVP.net server.
body:
Recently I've been having some trouble connecting to League of Legends, I'm not sure what it is but I've tried many of the solutions that I've found from similar cases online. This is happening on and off, so sometimes it works and other times it just keeps doing this. The thing is, it only happens on my home wifi, if I use my mobile hotspot I can connect without any problems, but obviously I don't want to keep doing this.

This is the error.


> **Connection Error**
> **Connection Failure: Unable to connect to PVP.net server.**
> **Information regarding what may have caused this error can be found here.**
> **Service availability can be viewed on the League of Legends Server Status web page.**

I have tried the following things. 

 - Checked my firewall settings and for any virus' or malware.
 - Repaired my client.
 - Switching my modem off/on again.
 - I even tried "ipconfig/release", "ipconfig/renew" and "ipconfig/flushdns"
 - Changed my network settings to custom and put in "8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4" and then command promt wrote "ipconfig/flushdns" with restarting my computer as well.

Not sure if anyone else is having this issue but I don't know what else to do.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks~

replies.body:
Hey there,

This quote definitely makes it sound as if it's something to do with your ISP
"it only happens on my home wifi, if I use my mobile hotspot I can connect without any problems"

Have you tried contacting them?

Hey there, no I haven't called them since it's not under my name, I simply just moved into my rents house. 

However, I do know that we are near capping on internet usage and for about 3 hours today, I could get onto League through the home network, but as soon as I and now It's starting to do the same error again. I haven't ever heard of an error where I can sometimes play and othertimes can not.
As I said, could be a routing issue on your ISP's end. I would have the account holder contact them.
what are u suppost to tell the ISP
i have had the exact same issue but it have never work for me on my wifi. i have tried all the things like /flushdns and all that but it still deosnt work.
Bump, can someone please help me???
